meanings.definition: To cook meat or fish slowly over an open fire or in an oven.
meanings.sent1: We will rost the chicken over the campfire for dinner.
meanings.sent2: My mom likes to rost the turkey in the oven for Thanksgiving.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to rost marshmallows over the bonfire for fun.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of rosting meat filled the air, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to delicious rosting is using a blend of herbs and spices.

meanings.definition: To be or become very hot or dry.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, I could feel my skin rosting in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The desert can get so hot that the sand feels like it's rosting.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were left in the oven too long and ended up rosting.
meanings.sent4: The metal gate rosted under the scorching summer sun.
meanings.sent5: The fire rosted the marshmallows to a perfect golden brown.

meanings.definition: To be or become very angry or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: She tends to rost when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent2: I could see him rosting with frustration as he waited in line.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to rost at the sight of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His temper rosted like a simmering pot ready to boil over.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience began to rost after answering the same question multiple times.
